title: Of the Traditions of the Church
text: It is not necessary that traditions and ceremonies be in all places one, or utterly like ... so that nothing be ordained against God's Word.
commentary: Article 34, “Of the Traditions of the Church”, states: It is not necessary that traditions and ceremonies be in all places one, or utterly like . The commentary below is a concise study essay offering historical context, theological significance, and suggestions for further study. Historically this Article reflects the Reformation effort to retain the catholic tradition where it is scriptural while rejecting practices viewed as unscriptural. For modern readers, note how this Article shapes worship, preaching, and ethical teaching, and compare it with patristic sources and later Anglican commentators.

footnotes.text: Gibson (1898), The Thirty-Nine Articles — general commentary.
Boultbee (1884), Historical notes on the Articles.
